intro: Excoecaria himalayensis, commonly known as Himalayan croton, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
